This is in a cute little square that we keep walking through in and around el born/la ribera.  We had eaten at Taller de Tapas earlier (good) and then a day later stopped at Sagardi to snack on pintxos between Palau de la Musica Catalana and dinner.  We had a blast.  The cava was amazing, and we enjoyed the pintxos (although I'm finding that there is not a ton of variety - everything is some variant of cod fish, crab meat, or cheese).  We had an amazing asparagus/mushroom tart, a crab meat croissant, a baked pepper with codfish, and various cheese options.  It wasn't too crowded at 9 so we were able to easily get to the bar, and it was a slightly more mature crowd than Euskal Etxea
